title: New team looking for Bronze - Gold players
body: Hello! I am starting up a team and am looking for a mid, top, jungler, and possibly a adc. I will not be playing on the team, just coaching it. This will be a semi serious team thats main focus is getting better together, learning new things about the game, and climbing through flex together. Practice's will be held at specific times each week based around the schedule of the main 5 members of the team. Tryouts will be tonight at 7:30pm EST. To lock in your spot for tryouts please leave below the role you wish to tryout for, your rank, and your top 5 champs! Thank you so much and i look forward to playing with you all!

replies.body: Last bump before tryouts start, invites will be sent out in 30 minutes. Make sure you have me added in game!

Silver last season in bronze right now climbing hoping to make it out of gold this season from a lot of grinding

Summoner is "urushi"

Rank: I'll start the placements now.

Why?
What is your motivation for doing this?
What is your gain?
How will you enforce teamwork?
Keep a schedule for a "semi-serious" team?
What is semi-serious?
Plans for tourneys? or simply just ranking up?
End goal of this all for you? for the team? for individual players on the team?

> [{quoted}](name=Magical Player,realm=NA,application-id=K6EGEal2,discussion-id=Y6YXYtxz,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2017-01-04T18:34:31.955+0000)
>
> Why?
> What is your motivation for doing this?
> What is your gain?
> How will you enforce teamwork?
> Keep a schedule for a "semi-serious" team?
> What is semi-serious?
> Plans for tourneys? or simply just ranking up?
> End goal of this all for you? for the team? for individual players on the team?



> What is your motivation for doing this?

As stated above i have friends in this elo who want to play on a team and i said id help them.

> What is your gain?

Coaching teams is fun to me, its a nice hobby. Plus as i said before its to help friends.

> How will you enforce teamwork?

Thats not a really hard thing to do, most people who take the time to tryout for a team usually are interested in getting better as a team and willing to listen to criticism to improve in their gameplay.

> Keep a schedule for a "semi-serious" team?

By scheduling practice around the 5 members availability, once again most people who want to try out for a team are willing to attend scheduled practices 

> What is semi-serious?

Playing rank together and climbing the ladder, as well as playing in scrims and possibly some low elo tourneys. 

> Plans for tourneys? or simply just ranking up?

Just rank until i feel that the teams ready to compete in tourneys, also the team will scrim other teams of equal elo.

> End goal of this all for you? for the team? for individual players on the team?

End goal for me is to help my friends and the other members of the team improve and leave the team better than they were when they joined.

IGN Still Running
Top 5 Champs  Irelia, Viktor, Renekton, Ahri, Lucian\
Gold 2 i think last season not sure silver 1 now

IGN: Not That H0le

Roles: Mid/JG/Support

Would try out for support and or JG

Top 5 Champs

Unranked Right now, MMR is Silver on Lolking and was Bronze 2 Last Season.

What experience do you have within league will enable you to coach us anywhere above your current rank?

How will you know if your decision was the best, or even the correct one, when analyzing our games as a team of 5?

Are you coaching the team as a 5? or individually across all players? or both

What experience do you have within league will enable you to coach us anywhere above your current rank?

 I have been diamond for 3 seasons now, and have played on and coached multiple high elo teams. 
http://eune.op.gg/summoner/userName=N1NJ4xHER0


 How will you know if your decision was the best, or even the correct one, when analyzing our games as a team of 5?

 As stated above i have a lot of experience in this area and am fairly confident in my ability to coach a bronze - gold elo team

Are you coaching the team as a 5? or individually across all players? or both

 Both, i will be helping the team as a whole improve and spending 1 on 1 time with players as needed to improve. Its important for each individual player to get better if a team is to get better.

Also that profile is from EUNE, are you in NA yourself as in residing?

and how can I be sure that profile is yours? lol sorry if I'm skeptical, but I could also find someone from eune who was diamond 5 for 3 seasons and name change to a similar compared to theirs, no offense, just my reason for all this skepticism.

Ive got a couple friends who are interested in playing on a team, but they're in the bronze - gold elo. So i told them id help them start a team and coach it.

I'm just trying to figure out if this is going to be a waste of time, or a great opportunity for my buddy.

I'm not trying to be rude or offend you. But it's true that anyone could've copied the name NINJAxHERO from eune over into NA.

As for your friend i can guarantee this is a very good opportunity for him if he gets on the team.
